column4: I'm trying to debug a problem I have with 'esd'. Q: Should /etc/esound/esd.conf  have "auto_spawn=1" ?
Does anyone know exactly how 'esd' is lanuched during startup? By gdm?
it is probably lauched when sound uses it if you have it set up right, sicne I know nothing uses it directly
Ok. It seems that esd gets launched twice during startup. Do you have any idea why?
not really but esd is the enlightenment sound daemon correct?

that is, I have two esd processes running, none is a "child process" of the other... So I suspect that esd is started twice. Also, in .xsession-errors, there are some complaints about "stale socket" for esd.
I dont know. :-) I only know that gnome uses it...?
this have worked berfore, and I have not tampered with anything lately. :-)   Wierd thing; if I boot every other time in "failsafe" mode, it works great during a normal boot.
yes, when I login, gnome gets stalled. When i killall esd, it continues. The USB mouse is sluggish too...
hmm probably has something on how esd is set up
well I don't know to much about usb mouses since I use my usb as a ps2
The mouse thing seems related to my problem with esd. When I do the every-second boot in "failsafe" the mouse works fine...
First i thought that the esd problem had to do with an old socket in /tmp. but now I dont know...
I've tried to set auto_spawn=0 in /etc/esound/esd.conf to, but at no avail. :-(
well did you delete the sock? since it's usually respawned on a boot anyways
yes, i did. I suspect thats why it also works every other time I boot in "failsafe", the socket gets whiped at startup...
at least it temporary fix your problem
yes, true, I'll try it. Thanks for the help!
overridden: I've to leave, thanks for the help! I'll return later. :-P
